msDesc.head: Aldobrandinus de Tuscanella, Scala fidei; Epistola Rabbi Samuelis ad Rabbi Isaac de adventu Messiae (tr. Alphonsus Bonihominis). Mainz Charterhouse, A) (fols 1–56) 1388; B) (fols 57–70) s. xv1.

physDesc.p: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1312–1319. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

supportDesc.extent: ii (17th-cent.) + 70 + ii (17th-cent.) leaves; fol. 71 a paper slip, pasted on fol. 72r.
supportDesc.collation: A) i–v 10 | vi 6 ; B) vii 12 | viii 2. Fol. 71 is a paper slip pasted to fol. 72r in the course of the Laudian Binding.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: The present manuscript consists of two parts, which were very likely produced at the Mainz Charterhouse and possibly bound together since the 15th century.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. ii verso.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). msItem.author: Aldobrandinus de Tuscanella
msItem.title: Scala fidei
msItem.note: With prologue (unpr.; Little 101 (‘Thomas (?) super Symbolum Apost. sive Scala Fidei’); T. Käppeli, ‘La tradizione manoscritta delle opere di Aldobrandino da Toscanella’, AFP 8 (1938) 163–92, at pp. 165–72 (with a complete list of incipits at pp. 167ff.); Kaeppeli 133 (recensio posterior), citing the present MS.; Schneyer 1. 250–52, nos 350–380; Stegmüller, RB, 1105, and suppl.; Zumkeller 335; Distelbrink 197; T. Hohmann, ‘Initienregister der Werke Heinrichs von Langenstein’, Traditio 32 (1976) 399–426, at p. 407 (no. 70); Bloomfield 2210).
msItem.finalRubric: (fol. 56ra) [red] Explicit libellus sermocionalis de articulis fidei vel. scala Iacob per quam ascenditur in celum. Finitus et completus in die marie magdalene Anno domini .Mo. CCCo. Lxxxuiijo.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, two columns of 29–34 lines without ruling. Ruled space
c.155–59 111–13

handDesc.handNote: textualis, with features of bastarda, very likely written at the Mainz Charterhouse, 1388, by a single hand.

history.origin: 1388 Germany, written likely at the Mainz Charterhouse, and finished on 22 July 1388 (see the colophon on fol. 56ra).
history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: fascicle A lacks any ex-libris inscription of the Mainz Charterhouse; its make-up, however, suggests that it was produced at the Charterhouse, where it was possibly consolidated with part B, in the 15th century.

msItem.author: Samuel Israelita
msItem.title: Epistola contra Iudaeorum errores
msItem.note: tr. Alfonsus Bonihominis, cap. 1–20 (imperfect), with dedicatory epistle and preface (numerous printed editions, e.g. Hain 14260–14271; ed.: MBVP 18 (Lyon, 1677) 519C–28C (= PL 149. 335A–58D); M. Marsmann, Die Epistel des Rabbi Samuel an Rabbi Isaak. Untersuchung und Edition (Siegen, 1971) 202–374, l. 1; Stegmüller, RB, 1183,1; Kaeppeli 146, citing the present MS.).
Paper slip pasted to fol. 72r: Obituary of the scholarius ‘Cristofferus Felseysen’. See printed catalogue for full description.

supportDesc.collation: vii 12 | viii 2. Fol. 71 is a paper slip pasted to fol. 72r in the course of the Laudian Binding (see item 3).

layoutDesc.layout:
(fols 57r–68v) Ruling in ink, one column of c.32–43 unruled lines. (fols 69r–70v) no framing and ruling. Ruled space
c.161–65 98–103

handDesc.handNote: bastarda, very likely Mainz Charterhouse, s. xv1, by one main hand, B1) (fols 57r–68v); the list of chapters on fols 69r–70r and the following note written in a contemporary hand (= hand B2); the last note on fol. 70r–v in a contemporary, very similar hand.

history.origin: 15th century, first half Germany, written likely at the Mainz Charterhouse.
history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the upper margin of fol. 70v: ‘Liber Cartusiensium prope magunciam’ (partially framed, in brown and red ink).
